column4: im using 10.04, from this article     http://linuxfud.wordpress.com/2007/02/14/how-to-reset-ubuntugnome-settings-to-defaults-without-re-installing/     it says to delete .gconf .gconfd .gnome2  and (.metacity .gnome) i found .gconf .gconfd and .gnome2 in /home/user/ ,, are .metacity and .gnome found somewhere else / do i need to copy them as well?
does it say what to copy
that article is basically  telling me to remove those directories in order to restore a users account to default w/o deleting the user
so why do you ask about copying anyting?
